alert.note: Alert for Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:36PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms with Frequent Cloud-to-Ground Lightning will impact portions of Wythe County through 515 PM EDT... At 434 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a small cluster of strong thunderstorms near Wytheville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Frequent Cloud-To-Ground Lightning. Heavy Rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Cloud-to-Ground Lightning can strike objects, structures, and people. Heavy rainfall can result in localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Wytheville... Max Meadows... Fort Chiswell... Cripple Creek... Grahams Forge... Gunton Park... and Ivanhoe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
